page.title: 02EWSHOTT
page.content: As yet Ewshott is an unspoilt hamlet set in a valley among trees.The houses are varied but the majority with superior standard with large gardens. On one side of the village stands the church, the old vicarage opposite. In the village is a well kept village hall near an immaculate recreation ground with swings etc. for children. There is one pub, a telephone and a post box.There are no shops, or a Post Office, or a bus service. The nearest shops and other facilities being at Crondall, Church Crookham or Fleet. Unfortunately Fleet is gradually creeping towards Ewshott.It is hoped that Ewshott can remain a village.
